content.question: This question is a short free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question. (7 points, suggested time 13 minutes) A student in a physics lab drops a ball of mass <math alttext="0.50 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>kg</mi></math> from a height of <math alttext="1.5 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> onto a force plate. The ball hits the force plate and rebounds upward. The student records the maximum height of the ball after it rebounds to be <math alttext="1.1 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math>. (a) The student uses their observations to correctly claim that the collision between the ball and the force plate is inelastic. Use the student’s observations to justify their claim.
